column2: 1.--Oriental Canapes.
column3: one.--Oriental Canapes.

column2: Take some lobster or crab-meat and pound in a mortar.
column3: Take some lobster or crab meat and pound in a mortar.

column2: Mix with 1 tablespoonful of butter; season with salt and pepper, a pinch each of mustard, cayenne, nutmeg and curry-powder and moisten with lemon-juice.
column3: Mix with one tablespoonful of butter; season with salt and pepper, a pinch each of mustard, cayenne, nutmeg and curry powder and moisten with lemon juice.

column2: Cut small rounds of toasted bread; scoop out some of the centre; fill with the mixture and cover with a curry sauce.
column3: Cut small rounds of toasted bread; scoop out some of the centre; fill with the mixture and cover with a curry sauce.

column2: Sprinkle with fine bread-crumbs and let bake in the oven a few minutes. Serve hot.
column3: Sprinkle with fine bread crumbs and let bake in the oven a few minutes. Serve hot.

column2: 2.--Haggis (SCOTCH).
column3: two.--Haggis (SCOTCH).

column2: Chop a sheep's tongue, liver and heart and 1 pound of bacon.
column3: Chop a sheep's tongue, liver and heart and one pound of bacon.

column2: Then clean the pouch of the sheep and fill with the mixture. Lay in boiling water and let boil three hours.
column3: Then clean the pouch of the sheep and fill with the mixture. Lay in boiling water and let boil three hours.

column2: Serve with apple-sauce.
column3: Serve with apple sauce.

column2: 3.--Austrian Braised Tongue.
column3: three.--Austrian Braised Tongue.

column2: Boil a large fresh beef tongue in salted water until tender.
column3: Boil a large fresh beef tongue in salted water until tender.

column2: Remove the tongue and lard it with thin strips of bacon; sprinkle with paprica; lay in a baking-pan; add 1 onion sliced thin and 1 cup of the water in which the tongue was cooked and pour over 1 pint of cream. Let bake in a moderate oven.
column3: Remove the tongue and lard it with thin strips of bacon; sprinkle with paprica; lay in a baking pan; add one onion sliced thin and one cup of the water in which the tongue was cooked and pour over one pint of cream. Let bake in a moderate oven.

column2: Baste often with the sauce.
column3: Baste often with the sauce.

column2: Serve hot, and pour over the sauce; garnish with parsley.
column3: Serve hot, and pour over the sauce; garnish with parsley.

column2: 4.--Russian Omelet.
column3: four.--Russian Omelet.

column2: Chop 2 shallots with a little parsley and cook in hot water.
column3: Chop two shallots with a little parsley and cook in hot water.

column2: Add 2 tablespoonfuls of caviare and a teaspoonful of lemon-juice; season to taste.
column3: Add two tablespoonfuls of caviare and a teaspoonful of lemon juice; season to taste.

column2: Beat 4 eggs with 1 tablespoonful of cream, salt and pepper, and fry in an omelet-pan with hot butter until done.
column3: Beat four eggs with one tablespoonful of cream, salt and pepper, and fry in an omelet pan with hot butter until done.

column2: Put the mixture in the centre; turn in the ends and serve at once.
column3: Put the mixture in the centre; turn in the ends and serve at once.

column2: 5.--Madras Potato Curry.
column3: five.--Madras Potato Curry.

column2: Cut boiled potatoes into thin slices; then fry 1 chopped onion in 2 tablespoonfuls of butter.
column3: Cut boiled potatoes into thin slices; then fry one chopped onion in two tablespoonfuls of butter.

column2: Add 3 ounces of grated cocoanut, 1 teaspoonful of curry-powder and 1 cup of milk, salt and cayenne pepper to taste.
column3: Add three ounces of grated cocoanut, one teaspoonful of curry powder and one cup of milk, salt and cayenne pepper to taste.

column2: Let boil up.
column3: Let boil up.

column2: Add the sliced potatoes and a sprig of parsley chopped.
column3: Add the sliced potatoes and a sprig of parsley chopped.

column2: Let simmer a few minutes and serve hot.
column3: Let simmer a few minutes and serve hot.

column2: 6.--Swiss Baked Eggs.
column3: six.--Swiss Baked Eggs.

column2: Melt 1 ounce of butter in a baking-pan; then cover the bottom of the pan with thin slices of Swiss cheese.
column3: Melt one ounce of butter in a baking pan; then cover the bottom of the pan with thin slices of Swiss cheese.

column2: Break in 6 eggs; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
column3: Break in six eggs; sprinkle with salt and pepper.

column2: Pour over 4 tablespoonfuls of cream; sprinkle with grated Swiss cheese, and let bake in the oven to a delicate brown. Serve hot.
column3: Pour over four tablespoonfuls of cream; sprinkle with grated Swiss cheese, and let bake in the oven to a delicate brown. Serve hot.

column2: 7.--Jewish Stewed Shad.
column3: seven.--Jewish Stewed Shad.

column2: Clean and cut a shad into large slices; sprinkle with salt, pepper and ginger.
column3: Clean and cut a shad into large slices; sprinkle with salt, pepper and ginger.

column2: Let boil until done and pour over the fish.
column3: Let boil until done and pour over the fish.

column2: Garnish with sliced lemon and sprigs of parsley and serve cold.
column3: Garnish with sliced lemon and sprigs of parsley and serve cold.

column2: 8.--Bombay Spinach.
column3: eight.--Bombay Spinach.

column2: Boil the spinach in salted water until tender; drain and chop fine. Fry 1 chopped onion in 2 tablespoonfuls of butter; add the chopped spinach, a pinch of pepper and curry-powder.
column3: Boil the spinach in salted water until tender; drain and chop fine. Fry one chopped onion in two tablespoonfuls of butter; add the chopped spinach, a pinch of pepper and curry powder.

column2: Cover and let simmer five minutes.
column3: Cover and let simmer five minutes.

column2: Serve on a platter with stewed prawns and garnish with croutons.
column3: Serve on a platter with stewed prawns and garnish with croutons.

column2: 9.--Spanish Fricasseed Shrimps.
column3: nine.--Spanish Fricasseed Shrimps.

column2: Heat 2 tablespoonfuls of butter; add 1 onion chopped and 2 cups of tomatoes.
column3: Heat two tablespoonfuls of butter; add one onion chopped and two cups of tomatoes.

column2: Stir in the yolk of an egg.
column3: Stir in the yolk of an egg.

column2: Put some boiled rice on a platter; add the shrimps and pour over the sauce.
column3: Put some boiled rice on a platter; add the shrimps and pour over the sauce.

column2: Serve very hot.
column3: Serve very hot.

column2: 10.--Irish Baked Potatoes.
column3: ten.--Irish Baked Potatoes.

column2: Peel and boil potatoes in salted water until tender; drain and mash with a lump of butter.
column3: Peel and boil potatoes in salted water until tender; drain and mash with a lump of butter.

column2: Put in the oven to brown.
column3: Put in the oven to brown.

column2: Serve with boiled fish.
column3: Serve with boiled fish.

column2: 11.--Russian Stewed Chicken.
column3: eleven.--Russian Stewed Chicken.

column2: Cut a fat chicken into pieces at the joints and let stew, well seasoned with salt and pepper.
column3: Cut a fat chicken into pieces at the joints and let stew, well seasoned with salt and pepper.

column2: Then add some small whole onions, some cauliflower, mushrooms and 1 cup of French peas.
column3: Then add some small whole onions, some cauliflower, mushrooms and one cup of French peas.

column2: Let all cook until tender; then serve hot on a large platter.
column3: Let all cook until tender; then serve hot on a large platter.

column2: 12.--Dutch Baked Mackerel.
column3: twelve.--Dutch Baked Mackerel.

column2: Place the mackerel in a baking-dish; sprinkle with pepper and chopped parsley.
column3: Place the mackerel in a baking dish; sprinkle with pepper and chopped parsley.

column2: Cover with fried bread-crumbs and bits of butter, and moisten with cream.
column3: Cover with fried bread crumbs and bits of butter, and moisten with cream.

column2: Then bake until brown on top and serve hot with stewed potatoes.
column3: Then bake until brown on top and serve hot with stewed potatoes.

column2: 13.--Polish Roast Mutton.
column3: thirteen.--Polish Roast Mutton.

column2: Season a leg of mutton with salt, pepper and a pinch of cloves.
column3: Season a leg of mutton with salt, pepper and a pinch of cloves.

column2: Lay in a baking-pan with 1 sliced onion, 2 celery roots, 3 cloves of garlic and 2 carrots cut fine, 1 bay-leaf, a sprig of thyme and a few peppercorns.
column3: Lay in a baking pan with one sliced onion, two celery roots, three cloves of garlic and two carrots cut fine, one bay leaf, a sprig of thyme and a few peppercorns.

column2: Pour over 1 cup of vinegar and 1 cup of hot water.
column3: Pour over one cup of vinegar and one cup of hot water.

column2: Dredge with flour and let bake in a hot oven.
column3: Dredge with flour and let bake in a hot oven.

column2: Baste often with the sauce in the pan until nearly done; then add 1 pint of sour cream and let bake until done.
column3: Baste often with the sauce in the pan until nearly done; then add one pint of sour cream and let bake until done.

column2: Thicken with flour; boil up and pour over the roast.
column3: Thicken with flour; boil up and pour over the roast.

column2: 14.--Italian Sugar Cakes.
column3: fourteen.--Italian Sugar Cakes.

column2: 15.--Oriental Stewed Prawns.
column3: fifteen.--Oriental Stewed Prawns.

column2: Clean and pick 3 dozen prawns.
column3: Clean and pick three dozen prawns.

column2: Add 1 pint of stock and let simmer half an hour until tender.
column3: Add one pint of stock and let simmer half an hour until tender.

column2: Serve on a border of boiled rice; garnish with fried parsley.
column3: Serve on a border of boiled rice; garnish with fried parsley.

column2: 16.--Swiss Steak.
column3: sixteen.--Swiss Steak.

column2: Season a round steak with salt, black pepper and paprica; dredge with flour and let fry in hot lard on both sides until brown.
column3: Season a round steak with salt, black pepper and paprica; dredge with flour and let fry in hot lard on both sides until brown.

column2: Cover and let simmer half an hour.
column3: Cover and let simmer half an hour.

column2: 17.--Berlin Herring Salad.
column3: seventeen.--Berlin Herring Salad.

column2: Soak the herring over night; remove the milch and mash fine.
column3: Soak the herring over night; remove the milch and mash fine.

column2: Cut off the head, skin and bone; chop the herring; add chopped apples, pickles, potatoes, olives and capers.
column3: Cut off the head, skin and bone; chop the herring; add chopped apples, pickles, potatoes, olives and capers.

column2: 18.--German Lentil Soup.
column3: eighteen.--German Lentil Soup.

column2: To 1 gallon of soup stock, add 1 quart of lentils.
column3: To one gallon of soup stock, add one quart of lentils.

column2: Let boil until lentils are soft, with 1 sliced onion.
column3: Let boil until lentils are soft, with one sliced onion.

column2: Then add some small sausages. Let boil five minutes.
column3: Then add some small sausages. Let boil five minutes.

column2: Season to taste and serve the soup with the sausages and croutons fried in butter.
column3: Season to taste and serve the soup with the sausages and croutons fried in butter.

column2: 19.--French Spiced Venison.
column3: nineteen.--French Spiced Venison.

column2: Rub the venison with salt, pepper, vinegar, cloves and allspice; then put in a baking-pan.
column3: Rub the venison with salt, pepper, vinegar, cloves and allspice; then put in a baking pan.

column2: Pour over a cup of melted butter; add 1 onion sliced, some thyme, parsley, the juice of a lemon, and a cup of hot water.
column3: Pour over a cup of melted butter; add one onion sliced, some thyme, parsley, the juice of a lemon, and a cup of hot water.

column2: Let bake, covered, in a hot oven.
column3: Let bake, covered, in a hot oven.

column2: Baste often with the sauce when nearly done.
column3: Baste often with the sauce when nearly done.

column2: Sprinkle with flour; add a glass of sherry and let brown.
column3: Sprinkle with flour; add a glass of sherry and let brown.

column2: Serve with celery and currant jelly.
column3: Serve with celery and currant jelly.

column2: 20.--Spanish Mushrooms.
column3: twenty.--Spanish Mushrooms.

column2: Drain 1 can of mushrooms and heat 2 tablespoonfuls of butter.
column3: Drain one can of mushrooms and heat two tablespoonfuls of butter.

column2: Add 6 shallots and 1 clove of garlic chopped fine, some parsley and thyme and the mushrooms.
column3: Add six shallots and one clove of garlic chopped fine, some parsley and thyme and the mushrooms.

column2: Let all fry a few minutes; then add the mushroom liquor and 2 tablespoonfuls of white wine, salt and pepper to taste. Let simmer five minutes and serve hot on slices of toast.
column3: Let all fry a few minutes; then add the mushroom liquor and two tablespoonfuls of white wine, salt and pepper to taste. Let simmer five minutes and serve hot on slices of toast.

column2: Boil some fine noodles in salted water for ten minutes; let drain. Beat the yolks of 5 eggs with 1 cup of pulverized sugar and mix with the noodles.
column3: Boil some fine noodles in salted water for ten minutes; let drain. Beat the yolks of five eggs with one cup of pulverized sugar and mix with the noodles.

column2: Put in a well-buttered pudding-dish and bake until brown.
column3: Put in a well buttered pudding dish and bake until brown.

column2: 22.--Dutch Sweet Potato Puff.
column3: twenty two.--Dutch Sweet Potato Puff.

column2: Peel and boil 3 sweet potatoes in salted water until tender; then mash well with 3 beaten yolks of eggs, 1 cup of milk, 3 tablespoonfuls of butter, 2 tablespoonfuls of sugar, a pinch of nutmeg and lemon-juice. Beat the whites with a pinch of salt to a stiff froth; add to the potatoes and put in a well buttered baking-dish and bake.
column3: Peel and boil three sweet potatoes in salted water until tender; then mash well with three beaten yolks of eggs, one cup of milk, three tablespoonfuls of butter, two tablespoonfuls of sugar, a pinch of nutmeg and lemon juice. Beat the whites with a pinch of salt to a stiff froth; add to the potatoes and put in a well buttered baking dish and bake.

column2: Serve hot.
column3: Serve hot.

column2: 23.--Spaghetti (ITALIAN).
column3: twenty three.--Spaghetti (ITALIAN).

column2: Drain.
column3: Drain.

column2: Then add 1 cup of milk; let boil and pour over the spaghetti.
column3: Then add one cup of milk; let boil and pour over the spaghetti.

column2: Sprinkle with salt, pepper and grated cheese and let bake in the oven until done. Serve hot.
column3: Sprinkle with salt, pepper and grated cheese and let bake in the oven until done. Serve hot.

column2: 24.--Russian Beet Soup.
column3: twenty four.--Russian Beet Soup.

column2: Boil 5 medium-sized beets until tender; then chop and add to a highly seasoned chicken broth.
column3: Boil five medium sized beets until tender; then chop and add to a highly seasoned chicken broth.

column2: Add the juice of 1 lemon, some cinnamon and nutmeg; let boil fifteen minutes.
column3: Add the juice of one lemon, some cinnamon and nutmeg; let boil fifteen minutes.

column2: Then add 1 glass of red wine, mixed with a teaspoonful of brown sugar.
column3: Then add one glass of red wine, mixed with a teaspoonful of brown sugar.

column2: Let boil a few minutes longer and serve with fried croutons.
column3: Let boil a few minutes longer and serve with fried croutons.

column2: 25.--Boulettes.
column3: twenty five.--Boulettes.

column2: Add 1 tablespoonful of lemon-juice, 2 tablespoonfuls of melted butter.
column3: Add one tablespoonful of lemon juice, two tablespoonfuls of melted butter.

column2: Season highly with salt, black pepper and a pinch of cayenne.
column3: Season highly with salt, black pepper and a pinch of cayenne.

column2: Mix with 1 egg and form into balls; roll in flour and fry in deep hot lard until brown.
column3: Mix with one egg and form into balls; roll in flour and fry in deep hot lard until brown.

column2: Serve hot with tomato-sauce.
column3: Serve hot with tomato sauce.

column2: 26.--Baden Stewed Lentils.
column3: twenty six.--Baden Stewed Lentils.

column2: Boil 1 quart of lentils until tender; then heat 2 tablespoonfuls of butter.
column3: Boil one quart of lentils until tender; then heat two tablespoonfuls of butter.

column2: Add 1 chopped onion and stir in 1 tablespoonful of flour until brown; add some cold water mixed with vinegar.
column3: Add one chopped onion and stir in one tablespoonful of flour until brown; add some cold water mixed with vinegar.

column2: Season with salt and pepper, and serve with small boiled sausages.
column3: Season with salt and pepper, and serve with small boiled sausages.

column2: Sprinkle the top with bread-crumbs fried in butter until brown.
column3: Sprinkle the top with bread crumbs fried in butter until brown.

column2: 27.--Duck aux Champignons.
column3: twenty seven.--Duck aux Champignons.

column2: Heat 2 tablespoonfuls of butter in a saucepan; add the ducks, 1 large onion chopped fine, 2 cloves of garlic and 1 herb bouquet chopped.
column3: Heat two tablespoonfuls of butter in a saucepan; add the ducks, one large onion chopped fine, two cloves of garlic and one herb bouquet chopped.

column2: Cover and brown a few minutes; add 1 cup of water and stew until tender.
column3: Cover and brown a few minutes; add one cup of water and stew until tender.
